title: Fairly heavy showers in parts of the island today
byline: The Department of Meteorology says that showers or thundershowers will occur at times in Western, Sabaragamuwa and North-western provinces and in Galle and Matara districts today (16).

title: Environmental concerns mount after fuel bowser accident in Kotmale
byline: Approximately 13,000 litres of diesel and petrol were discharged following a bowser accident on Tuesday (14) along the Nuwara Eliya–Kirimetiya road, raising serious environmental concerns after fuel leaked into key water sources and the Upper Kotmale Reservoir.

title: Opposition party secretaries to meet Sajith for talks on LG bodies
byline: The Secretaries of several opposition parties have agreed to hold discussions with Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa regarding the forming of administrations in local government bodies, following a meeting held in Colombo on Wednesday night (15).

title: Six Sri Lankans held for attempting illegal re-entry from India
byline: Six Sri Lankan nationals have been arrested by police in the Valvettithurai sea area off Jaffna over an attempt to illegally re-enter Sri Lanka from India.

title: Rooftop solar capacity surpasses 1,700 MW in Sri Lanka
byline: The Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) says it has achieved a major renewable energy milestone, reaching 1,700 MW of installed rooftop solar capacity across the country.

title: Two arrested for attempting to smuggle gold worth Rs. 210M at BIA
byline: Two passengers have been arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) at Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake for attempting to smuggle gold valued at Rs. 210 million.

title: Two injured as cab transporting avocados overturns in Hatton
byline: A double cab transporting a consignment of avocados veered off the road and overturned into a tea estate located approximately 50 feet below the Hatton-Colombo main road early this morning (May 16).

title: Trump and Abu Dhabi ink partnership to build massive AI data center complex in UAE
byline: The United States and United Arab Emirates will partner to build a massive data center complex in Abu Dhabi to advance artificial intelligence capabilities with 5-gigawatts of capacity — enough to power a major city.

title: ‘Creating safe workplaces for women is critically important’ – PM Harini
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated that significant attention must be drawn to the safety of women in employment, and a secure environment should be created for them in the workplace.

title: Three sentenced to death for trafficking heroin via fishing vessel
byline: The Colombo High Court today (16) sentenced three individuals to death for the possession and trafficking of heroin.

title: Police crackdown on unsafe long-distance buses; 11 drivers charged
byline: On the directive of Acting Inspector General of Police Priyantha Weerasuriya, Sri Lanka Police have commenced inspections of long-distance public and private buses across the country to ensure passenger safety following multiple recent passenger bus accidents.

title: Deshabandu to appear before inquiry committee on Monday
byline: Suspended Inspector General of Police (IGP) Deshabandu Tennakoon is scheduled to appear before the inquiry committee, appointed to investigate and report on allegations of misconduct and serious abuse of office against him, on Monday (19).

title: Sri Lanka nears one million tourist arrivals in 2025
byline: The Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA) has reported that the number of foreign tourist arrivals in the country in 2025 is approaching the one million mark.

title: Ex-President Ranil defended Chamara Sampath after appeal by MP’s wife, court told
byline: The complaint filed by the Bribery Commission against MP Chamara Sampath Dassanayake was taken up before Colombo Chief Magistrate Thanuja Lakmali today (May 16).

title: Newly appointed Sri Lankan diplomats call on Foreign Minister
byline: Sri Lanka’s newly appointed seven Heads of Missions-designate recently called on the Minister of Foreign Affairs, Vijitha Herath, following the conclusion of the orientation programme conducted by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism, according to a statement issued today (16).

title: Court rejects Bribery Commission’s request to revoke bail granted to MP Chamara Sampath
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court has rejected the request made by the Bribery Commission to revoke the bail granted to MP Chamara Sampath Dassanayake and remand him in custody over an ongoing bribery case.

title: Bribery Comm. files case against two including ex-Minister Lakshman Yapa
byline: The Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) has filed a case against former Minister of Investment Promotion Lakshman Yapa Abeywardena and former Director General of the Board of Investment (BOI) Jayantha Edirisinghe, over the alleged misuse of public funds for newspaper advertisements in 2014.

title: Ten students further remanded over Sabaragamuwa Uni. ragging incident
byline: Ten students arrested in connection with a ragging incident at the University of Sabaragamuwa, which allegedly led to the suicide of a fellow student, have been further remanded until May 29.

title: Kajal Aggarwal joins Nitesh Tiwari’s Ramayana as ‘Mandodari’
byline: Actor Kajal Aggarwal, who recently appeared in Salman Khan’s Sikandar, is reportedly set to portray Mandodari in Nitesh Tiwari’s highly anticipated cinematic adaptation of the Ramayana. Sources close to the production indicate she will star opposite Yash, who is cast as Ravana, in the epic two-part film.

title: Dematagoda railway crossing to remain closed on May 24
byline: Sri Lanka Railways has announced that the Dematagoda railway crossing will remain completely closed for vehicular traffic on May 24 due to urgent repair work.

title: India weighs plan to slash Pakistan water supply with new Indus river project
byline: India is considering plans to dramatically increase the water it draws from a major river that feeds Pakistani farms downstream, as part of retaliatory action for a deadly April attack on tourists that New Delhi blames on Islamabad, according to four people familiar with the matter.

title: President urges DCC chairs to boost production economy and rural development
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has urged all Chairpersons of District Coordinating Committees (DCC) to actively engage in revitalizing the nation’s production-oriented economy and fostering rural development.

title: Mexican beauty influencer shot to death during TikTok livestream
byline: A young Mexican social media influencer, known for her videos about beauty and makeup, was brazenly shot to death during a TikTok livestream, in an incident that sent shockwaves through a country that faces high levels of gender-based violence.

title: IUSF Convenor among several arrested during protest in Colombo
byline: Police have arrested at least seven protesters, including the Convenor of the Inter-University Students’ Federation (IUSF), for violating a court order during a protest held in front of the Ministry of Health in Colombo today (16).

title: Peaceful remembrance events wrongfully criminalised: HRCSL raises concern over misuse of ICCPR Act
byline: The Human Rights Commission of Sri Lanka (HRCSL) has expressed serious concerns over the continued misapplication of legal provisions, particularly Section 3 of the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights (ICCPR) Act, in relation to commemoration events held in the North and East of the country.

title: Warrant issued for arrest of ex-minister Mahindananda
byline: The Colombo Chief Magistrate’s Court has issued a warrant for the arrest of former Agriculture Minister Mahindananda Aluthgamage over the alleged importation of a substandard shipment of organic fertiliser from a Chinese firm in 2021.

title: Man and woman injured in shooting at Kotahena
byline: Two persons have reportedly been injured and hospitalised following a shooting incident at Sumithrarama Road in Kotahena.

title: Night mail trains cancelled as station masters strike
byline: Railway Station Masters have decided to launch a token strike from midnight today, resulting in all night mail trains being cancelled.

title: Environmental concerns mount after Talawakele fuel bowser accident
byline: Approximately 13,000 litres of diesel and petrol were discharged following a bowser accident on Tuesday (14) along the Nuwara Eliya–Kirimetiya road in Talawakele, raising serious environmental concerns after fuel leaked into key water sources and the Upper Kotmale Reservoir.

title: President directs ministry officials to accelerate implementation of digital economic solutions
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake held a meeting this afternoon (May 16) at the Presidential Secretariat with officials of the Ministry of Digital Economy and heads of relevant institutions to discuss the progress of Sri Lanka’s digital economic initiatives.

title: Ex-President Ranil accuses Bribery Comm. of wilfully misleading court
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe says that the submissions made with reference to him in court today by the Counsel for the Bribery Commission is a wilful misleading of the Court and that he is consulting his lawyers regarding the action to be taken.
